tweet_text: If Phineas and Ferb were real, they probably would have already invented a vaccine.

In 1955, the polio vaccine was released and many people eagerly lined up to receive it. At that time, artificial satellites were still two years away from being launched into space. Fast forward to 2021, we now carry powerful external devices in our pockets that connect us to the world, and robots have been sent to explore the surface of Mars. Despite all of this progress, some people are still refusing to take the COVID vaccine, falsely believing that it contains harmful substances.

Today, I checked in with my mom to see if she experienced any side effects after receiving her second vaccine shot. To my surprise, she responded by saying that she gained a newfound appreciation for science.

She dedicated years of her life to volunteering with the House of Ruth, helping to save women from domestic violence. Our family is devastated by this loss, as we mourn the passing of a truly beautiful soul. Rest in peace. ❤️

COVID-19 is a global virus and will affect people all around the world, regardless of the season.
